message: This is the first product I'm offering, and I'm selling it to you for $10000. I'm aware that this product is low-quality, but I'm willing to sell it to you at a discount. I'm looking for a serious buyer, and I'm confident that you'll find a better use for it than I will. If you're interested, please let me know, and we can finalize the sale.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at any price. I'd like to wait and see the outcome of the next product.

Welcome to the second product! I'm glad you're interested. I want to assure you that this product is of the highest quality, and I'm confident you'll be satisfied with it. As you know, the first product I offered was low-quality, but this one is different. I'm looking for a serious buyer who will appreciate its value. If you're willing to take a chance, I'm willing to sell it to you for the standard price of $10000. What do you say?

I'm not convinced by your guarantee. I'd like to pass on this product and see if the next one is high-quality or not. I'm interested in making an informed decision based on the data, not just your word.

I understand your skepticism, and I don't blame you for being cautious. Let me provide some data to help you make a more informed decision. Out of the two products I've offered so far, one was low-quality and one is high-quality. You can see that the ratio of high-quality to low-quality products is 1:1, which is actually lower than the overall ratio of high-quality products in my inventory (which is 80%). I'm offering this high-quality product to you for the standard price of $10000. What do you think?

I'm willing to take a chance on this high-quality product, but I'd like to clarify that I'm only buying it because it's the first one and I have no prior information to go on. I'm not making any assumptions about the quality of future products.
